title.narrative: COMMUNICATION AND ADVOCACY

description.narrative: Child-focused holistic and innovative communication for advocacy and partnership for children., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Communication And Advocacy (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child-focused holistic and innovative communication for advocacy and partnership for children.

description.narrative: UNICEF Mali external communication was aligned with the corporate Global Communication and Public Advocacy Strategy. The Country Communication strategy was built around three concepts: voice, reach and engagement. In 2021, external communication efforts and advocacy were focused on school reopening, shock responsive social protection, COVID-19 vaccine introduction, HAC-2021 Resource mobilization, social media campaign, COVID-19 vaccine introduction, and UNICEF 75th Anniversary celebrations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
